Scratch - Scratch Day Lausanne 2016 (by Max)

Scratch Day Lausanne 2016 (by Max) on Scratch by VassilisTouloum

item.title: Professor Pranksman fools his students with a TA powered by IBM's Watson
item.description:
Professor Pranksman fools his students with a TA powered by IBM's Watson

Ashok Goel, a computer science professor at Georgie Institute of Technology, recently pulled a huge prank on his students: he gave them a robot for a teaching assistant. "Jill Watson" did regular TA work, like remind students of due dates and answer questions, all over email.

item.title: Deutsche Bahn looking at adding autonomous cars to its mass transit network
item.description:
Deutsche Bahn looking at adding autonomous cars to its mass transit network

German railway giant Deutsche Bahn is working on adding autonomous cars to its transport network as a way of getting riders to and from the train station - the last mile, so to speak. It's even looking at competing with companies like Uber in getting travelers around urban areas where a train might not be practical.

item.title: Raspberry Pi tube amp lets you use $1,300 headphones with your $35 computer
item.description:
Raspberry Pi tube amp lets you use $1,300 headphones with your $35 computer

The Raspberry Pi is one of the most versatile little computers ever created, and it can do all kinds of things - like powering robots, arcade machines, and now, expensive headphones.

item.title: Tesla's newest Easter egg hides a rainbow inside the charging port
item.description:
Tesla's newest Easter egg hides a rainbow inside the charging port

It may be an upstart in the automotive world, but Tesla already has a healthy tradition of including Easter eggs in its software updates. The most recent to be spotted treats Tesla owners to a miniature light show - Model S and Model X owners who press the button on their car's charging handle ten times in quick succession will see their charging port light up in the colors of the rainbow.

item.title: Nvidia's new graphics cards are a big deal
item.description:
Nvidia's new graphics cards are a big deal

The hotly anticipated Nvidia GeForce GTX 1080 is now official, marking a major leap in performance and efficiency with the introduction of the new Pascal architecture. How major? Take the ultra beefy and expensive Titan X graphics card from last year, slice its power demands from 250W to 180W, cut its price from $999 to $599, and then throw in a bit more performance on top.

item.title: Miniatur Wunderland is a jaw-dropping sight for kids young and old
item.description:
Miniatur Wunderland is a jaw-dropping sight for kids young and old

On a road trip across Germany earlier this year, my wife and I made a four-hour detour to visit Miniatur Wunderland. It's Hamburg's most popular tourist attraction and it was, without question, worth the trip. Miniatur Wunderland is the Guinness Book of World Records-certified largest model railroad in the world, with more than 150 staff.
